 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 4.1 - COMPATIBLE
NAME, ROLE, VALUE(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements,
links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be
programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by
the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items
is available to user agents, including assistive technologies. 

These websites...

Maximize compatibility with current and future user agents, including assistive
technologies.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 Accessible APIs 

A Java applet uses the accessibility API defined by the language. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/name-role-value.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
